intro: Launaea stenocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed launaea, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with a distinctive, often hairy texture. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with woody stems and small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Launaea stenocephala is adapted to survive in harsh environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
